appearances.title: The Weeknight : MSNOW : January 1, 2026 4:00pm-5:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: it was lauren boebert, it was nancy mace. and there should be all of the republicans within the conference who are willing to stand up for the thousands of women who were trafficked by jeffrey epstein and willing to put their neck out on an issue like this. but i do think that marjorie taylor greene is seeing that trump is going back on his word to the maga movement. he underestimated just how important an issue this was to the maga base. and siouxsie wiles admitted that his chief of staff in a vanity fair profile that she did. she said that the trump administration whiffed on this issue when talking about attorney general pam bondi, and that she underestimated just how much of an impact this issue would have. and so i think that the women of the gop are finding their voice. it's taken a bit, but i commend them for being willing to stand up to trump, even if it is when he's already a lame duck president. >> so the most important question in journalism i've learned from watching you, alicia, and others, is the question of why.

appearances.title: MS NOW Reports : MSNOW : January 2, 2026 12:00pm-1:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: but to add to that list, you just walked us through, add lauren boebert, who is now alleging that president trump has retaliated against her by vetoing what was a pretty popular clean water bill that would have helped her constituents. do you expect to see these kinds of defections more and more of this kind of tension on that side? >> i think we could see a lot more republicans, potentially democrats, saying that they're going to leave congress. but the white house has been very firm that they believe that their version of policies and their agenda is what they believe is a winning agenda for republicans to run on. and something that i'm really watching as as the president travels the country, which republicans show up and which don't, i think a lot of republicans have made the calculation that they still need to align themselves with president trump, because going against him can have such deep repercussions. >> kayla gardner and former congressman charlie dent, thank you both so much. aaron and megan, you're sticking around with me. still ahead. just hours after taking office, what mayor

appearances.snippet: the bill was authored by colorado republican congresswoman lauren boebert. she was a longtime trump ally until they disagreed over releasing the jeffrey epstein files. trump also vetoed a bill that would have granted florida's miccosukee tribe of indians more control of its land. that tribe was part of a lawsuit against the trump administration over an immigration detention center in the everglades. both bills were not considered controversial. coming up, a good samaritan taken to the hospital after being attacked at a caltrain station. and just a quick reminder here that you can get ktvu on demand on your smart tv through the fox local app. you can watch all newscasts live and see all types of in-depth content from our newsroom on a variety of topics. it is a free download for your sma tv. we're back (coughing) (sneeze) (♪) alka-seltzer plus cold or flu fizzychews. chew. fizz. feel better fast. no water needed. alka-seltzer plus fizzychews. turn right. this is how you make crispy korean fried chicken. wifi speeds as fast as home, even when you're on the go.

appearances.title: Velshi : MSNOW : January 10, 2026 7:00am-10:00am PST
appearances.snippet: the republican lauren boebert, whose district in colorado is most affected by the president's veto, toldters this. >> one was against us on policy. and my my response to this is really short and sweet. promises made need to be promises kept. this was a promise under president trump. >> all right, for more on this, i'm joined by longtime political journalist michael shaw. michael, make sense of this because when i saw this happen, the big news is that there was there was a veto and there was an attempt by congress to overturn the veto. and then you look a little deeper at what the bills are. and i was it was mind boggling. >> yeah, it's well, it's not mind boggling now. right now it's obvious. yeah. now it's kind of obvious thing that we would see. it's the politics of retribution, which is not new with donald trump. the politics of retribution has happened for a very long time. but right now, the way it's being enacted at every single turn, we've never seen anything like this. so nothing can be done. if you wrong the king, then the king will take it out on you. and that's what we're seei
